poem:
No Kings  

In scattered streets,  
a ripple of voices rings—  
no kings, they chant,  
a symphony on wind's edge,  
unity like petals scattered  
in a spring parade,  
where hope buds  
in furious bloom,  
people rising like  
the sun unfurling upon  
a nation hungry  
for its own light,  
casting shadows  
into brighter days.

Leaders of the movement estimated during a press conference on Thursday that there will be more than 2,500 demonstrations throughout the US. “We do not expect there to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
